comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: There looks to have been a Bushmens Contingent at Kensington Racecourse as well ??? "The Bushmen's Contingent, mounted, will leave Kensington racecourse at 1 o'clock p.m. to-mor- row, for Cowper Wharf, where the embarkation will take place on the transports Maplemore and Atlantian." trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14296667 It looks like there were contingents camped at Kensington till at least April 1900. trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14303307 -AG

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Ha! Sorry - "Randwick Racecourse" is my error; I mistakenly thought Kensington and Randwick Racecourses were one and the same. Kensington Racecourse was a pony course on the site of the UNSW - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kensington_Racecourse,_Sydney 1907 interactive map showing both - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-db66-sd&rgn=0.4...

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: It looks like the Bushmen's Contingent moved from Randwick Rifle range to Kensignton Racecourse in February 1900: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article14292634 And then to Rookwood in April 1900: trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14303307 This article describes the march of one contingent from Rookwood to the Harbour: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article14307506 So I guess the exact month and the location of the contingent that this particular man is part of is up for debate!?! -AG

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Yes, all debatable!  At least it is likely to be definitely (not c.) 1900.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
True enough - I'll update the date to "year only 1900"!
-AG
